needs.description: WHO reports a surge in acute watery diarrhea cases, with 8,450 suspected cases recorded in Greater Cairo between January and February 2026, linked to contaminated water supplies. Hospitals in Giza and Cairo governorates are operating at 92% bed occupancy, with critical shortages of IV fluids and oral rehydration salts.

UNICEF data shows that 1.3 million residents in informal settlements lack access to safely managed water, with 42% of water samples testing positive for E. coli. The Cairo Water Authority reports 23% of pipelines in eastern districts are damaged due to aging infrastructure and recent flooding.

IOM estimates 45,000 internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Greater Cairo, primarily from conflict-affected areas in North Sinai and Upper Egypt, living in overcrowded collective shelters with limited access to services.

needs.description: WHO data shows 3,600 suspected dengue fever cases in Sohag governorate in 2026, with 12 confirmed deaths. Vector control efforts are hampered by stagnant water in agricultural areas following heavy rains in late 2025.

OCHA reports that 650,000 people in Sohag lack access to improved sanitation facilities, with open defecation practiced in 18 rural districts. Flooding damaged 34 water treatment plants in December 2025.

needs.description: IOM estimates 230,000 IDPs in North Sinai governorate, displaced by ongoing conflict since 2013. Over 60% are hosted in overcrowded informal settlements with limited humanitarian access due to security constraints.

UNHCR reports 1,450 unaccompanied and separated children in North Sinai, with limited access to psychosocial support or family tracing services. Armed clashes in January 2026 displaced an additional 8,200 people.

WHO documents 42 attacks on health facilities in North Sinai since 2023, with only 3 of 12 hospitals fully functional. Maternal mortality ratio in the governorate is 198 per 100,000 live births, double the national average.
